title: Thunderbird on new computer
content:
I have installed Thunderbird on new computer. The first account that I set up works great. I then added second and third accounts. First account can send and receive email. Second and third accounts can receive email but when I try to send, I get a msg telling me that the msg size exceeds the global size limit of the server and to reduce the size and send again. And, to use port 587...which I am using. The msg is NOT too large, typically, it is, "This is a test."

See attached pic. I'd really appreciate help pointing me in the right direction. 

Thanks.

Rich M.
creator: Medrod

title: Threads by sender email address, sorted by date. Possible?
content:
Hi, I have been using The Bat! client from Ritlabs for ages and reason for this is its capability to display messages threaded by "From" header and then sorted by date. This way, if sender X sends me an email, sender X will be first in the list and I can expand/collapse his name to see all the messages ever received from him. I love this because threading by message ids and subjects does not always work (honestly, it does not work for me most of the time to the expected degree)!

Is it possible to achieve similiar behaviour in Thunderbird (115)?

The closest I got in Thunderbird was to setting "View > Sort by > From", "View > Sort by > Grouped by sort" and "View > Threads > Collapse All Threads". But when I click on Date columns, the all idea is lost.

Attached screen shows expanded thread "Firefox Accounts (accounts@firefox.com" as the first entry because its message is the latest. Followed by "Airbnb (automated@airbnb.com" and when I expand it, I find all messages from this sender. Etc...

Thanks. Boris
creator: qwerty4

title: slow, must reboot consistantly. Win10
content: This program is deeply flawed. It's slow & must be rebooted multiple times a day. Then at times it works just fine. What's the problem & how to fix? The address book doesn't show what folder you put a contact in. The old version did. This is a flaw too.
creator: twolf2

title: Compose soft word wrap (HTML format) does not use window size
content:
In the Compose window, composing in HTML format with the Formatting Bar visible: The soft word wrap only wraps to the maximum of the window width or the Formatting Bar width. Since I typically compose with a window narrower than the Formatting Bar, this causes the right side of my message to be hidden.

Turning off the Formatting Bar returns word wrap to its normal function. This is not a solution, of course; only a work-around.

As far as I know, this started with version 115.0.1; at least, I did not notice this before, and I use Thunderbird on a daily basis.
creator: James6M

title: I can't find new incoming email!
content: I have used Thunderbird for a very long time, but now, I am really pissed. Today (and in the recent past) I got a new incoming email. I could not find it! You bury my emails and do not give me any notice of where it is. I do not want buried emails. I liked it the way it was. I could miss a very important message! I have to go down line by line searching for them! If this is not changed, I will be looking for a new client.

title: Cannot receive new email messages
content:
While away from my computer for a few days, Thunderbird stopped retrieving new emails. I noticed this when I returned. I'm using imap to download from the server. Logging in to the server via browser shows that there indeed new emails. Quitting Thunderbird and restarting results in showing old emails and a spinner (slider?) on the Inbox tab that never stops. I have not changed configuration recently (I was away when this started). I followed a suggestion to delete cert9.db, key4.db, and logins.json. Doing this and restarting changed nothing. My understanding is that this should have deleted my server password information, but I was not prompted for a password on restart. I have uploaded a snapshot of the "Troubleshooting information" tab to pastebin:

https://pastebin.com/fsB64yiu

title: Junk Filter doesn't delete despite "Delete them" being checked.
content: This is an ongoing problem and it has been around for years. I know it existed in 102 and also now in 115. That is that despite the Junk Settings being set to "Delete them" under the checked statement "When I mark messages as junk", they do not ever get deleted. I have to manually delete items marked as junk, which is mostly accurate. So in my inbox, I just see a multitude of items marked as junk each morning until I re-sort by junk status instead of date and then easily delete them and then go back to sort by date.

title: Problem to send big mail with Thunderbird
content:
Hi, I can not send big mail with Thunderbird now. My mail is: gunnar@isia.se and domain ISIA I have with TELIA, in Sweden the big provider. Error Message:

Det gick inte att skicka meddelandet. Ett fel uppstod när e-post skulle skickas. Servern svarade: 36GCQZbn026170 This message has been blocked for containing SPAM-like characteristics.


Small mail works OK. There is no problem when using TELIA WEBMAIL. My beleive is that big mail text gets warning for SPAM and that Thunderbird take that as FATAL, it should send anyway, it is not FATAL.

What can I do ??? is there any HELP ? Regards Gunnar Lagerlof

title: Thunderbird stopped showing messages older than 2 weeks in the inbox.
content:
I have Thunderbird set up on multiple devices. Each device accesses the same group of multiple email addresses. On one of the computers for one of the addresses the messages in the inbox are disappearing after 2 weeks. The emails are still showing up on other devices - so they are not gone from the server. The settings are set to "never delete" for the email in question. The other email addresses still show messages older than two weeks.

I'm rather new to using Thunderbird so maybe I'm missing something simple, but I'm not finding any way to correct this. I have not tried a re-install yet.

Any suggestions would be appreciated.

title: Problema account con grande numero di email
content:
Buongiorno,

da alcune settimane mi ritrovo Thunderbird che funziona molto male e continua a darmi errori su spazio disco mancante. L'errore esatto è: Alcune cartelle (ad esempio "Posta in arrivo su mioindirizzoemail") non possono essere compattate perché lo spazio sul disco è insufficiente. Eliminare alcuni file e riprovare.

Lo spazio disco c'è, 20 GB disponibili.

Da diversi mesi riscontro inoltre un "freeze" di Thunderbird quando arriva una email.

Se fino ad ora ho continuato accettando il problema, adesso purtroppo la situazione sta peggiorando e chiedo se forse il problema sia causato dal grande numero di email (parliamo di circa 130000 email per circa 45 GB di spazio occupato).

C'è qualche problema noto con account con numero di email elevato?

Grazie

Mauro
creator: mauro.narduzzi

title: AutoArchive and Conversation Clean Up Functionality
content:
Hello,

Does Thunderbird support any functionality similar to that of Outlook's:

  • AutoArchive AutoArchive
  • Based on https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/archived-messages this support article, it seems that the answer is "No".
  • Conversation Clean Up Conversation Clean Up
  • There is a plugin plugin which checks for duplicate emails, but isn't quite the same as the conversation cleanup which only keeps the latest email in a thread (ensuring that the email contains all the previous content).
creator: ConfusedAnemone

content:

Use Case: Adding a task to a CalDav-synced calendar, and close Thunderbird before it hits the usual 5-minute (or whatever user-specified) scheduled sync. Then the task is not synced, even though the user expectation is that the task would be available on the synced calendar.

title: Sned mail to multiple adresses (50+)
content:
Hello,

I have a task where I need to send similar important mails to 50+ comapnies. The mail will ask for important information from these companies. Therefore It cannot look like a mass mail. These companies all have been in contact with us before and we are in process of buying something from them. This is not an attemt to spam or scam anyone.

How can I manage sendeing 50 or more similar mails to an excel list of mail adresses? (maybe even with a text adressing a certain person) How can i prevent ending up in the spam folder? I also do not want to send it as BC to everyone.

Is there a built in feature like this? Or is there a way to add emails from an excel sheet to the adress book and then send to everyone in the adress book?

Regards
creator: Dire_tissima

title: Selected header does not match loaded body on IMAP
content:
Hey Team,

This is a problem that I have seen a few times over the years but is causing me some real headaches at the moment for one specific customer who uses TB.

The computers in question are fully patched windows 10 with TB 115 installed.

When clicking on an email header / selecting an email from the message list, sometimes, a different email body is loaded into the message pane. Sometimes moving the message to a different folder seems to resolve the issue but I'm not sure that this works 100% of the time. We have also had instances where an email has been replied to but the wrong email body has been included in the reply (bit if a data security concern...)

I am assuming that somewhere along the lines the link between the downloaded headers and the message bodies is getting out of sync. My current "fix" is to remove the account, remove the data then add the account back. This seems to fix things but doesn't seem like the right way to do it.

Can anyone offer any advise on either;

  1. How to prevent this from happening in the first place
  2. More efficiently re-sync all of the headers to bodies (assuming that this is the issue)

Help and advice, greatly received.
creator: garethqct
